Articles.Content: So I saw an SSTO that looked like a whale so I wanted to make one that was as close to a whale as I could.  Initial testing was not too bad 44t should have been able to go super sonic with 2 rappiers but it couldnt top 140 m/s.  So I added 2 more clipped in for ascetic reasons.  Now it can do 300 m/s but still cant break the sound barrier.  The cockpits are attached in the cargo bays so they shouldnt produce drag but they are.  Also the rover in the cargo bay appears to be creating drag as well.
Try replace ramp with something else - I vaguely remember ramps are pretty draggy even closed.

I don't see anything inherently wrong with the shape. I was able to get mine up to mach 1 with 2 RAPIERs, though it was only just barely, as mine was somewhat too heavy.

I only see one pair of Radial Ramp intakes on yours. RAPIERs require 2 each or they'll lose thrust.

Is the Rover docked? Otherwise it creates drag as if it was attached on the outside.

Yes I used KIS to build a dock for the rover. Rover was not built in the SPH. I took the plane out without the rover and only 2 engines and I was able to get Mach 2 like you without the rover but it still seams draggy I will post more pics later
